h3902.definition: from {{h3899}}; foodful; (or perhaps erroneous transcription) for {{h1022}}; Lachmi, an Israelite; or rather probably a brief form; Lahmi. See also {{h3433}}.

h3903.definition: probably by erroneous transcription for לַחְמָם; from {{h3899}}; food-like; Lachmam or Lachmas, a place in Palestine; Lahmam.

h3904.definition: (Aramaic) from an unused root of uncertain meaning; a concubine; concubine.

h3905.definition: a primitive root; properly, to press, i.e. (figuratively) to distress; afflict, crush, force, hold fast, oppress(-or), thrust self.

h3907.definition: a primitive root; to whisper; by implication, to mumble a spell (as a magician); charmer, whisper (together).

h3908.definition: from {{h3907}}; properly, a whisper, i.e. by implication, (in a good sense) a private prayer, (in a bad one) an incantation; concretely, an amulet; charmed, earring, enchantment, orator, prayer.

h3909.definition: a form of {{h3814}} or else participle from {{h3874}}; properly, covered, i.e. secret; by implication, incantation; also secrecy or (adverb) covertly; enchantment, privily, secretly, softly.

h3910.definition: probably from {{h3874}}; a gum (from its sticky nature), probably ladanum; myrrh.

h3911.definition: from an unused root meaning to hide; a kind of lizard (from its covert habits); lizard.

h3912.definition: masculine plural of passive participle of {{h3913}}; hammered (i.e. oppressed) ones; Letushim, an Arabian tribe; Letushim.

h3913.definition: a primitive root; properly, to hammer out (an edge), i.e. to sharpen; instructer, sharp(-en), whet.

h3914.definition: a form of {{h3880}}; a wreath; addition.

h3915.definition: or (Isaiah 21:11) לֵיל; also לַיְלָה; from the same as {{h3883}}; properly, a twist (away of the light), i.e. night; figuratively, adversity; (mid-)night (season).

h3917.definition: from {{h3915}}; a night spectre; screech owl.

h3918.definition: from {{h3888}} in the sense of crushing; a lion (from his destructive blows); (old) lion.

h3919.definition: the same as {{h3918}}; Laish, the name of two places in Palestine; Laish. Compare {{h3889}}.

h3920.definition: a primitive root; to catch (in a net, trap or pit); generally, to capture or occupy; also to choose (by lot); figuratively, to cohere; × at all, catch (self), be frozen, be holden, stick together, take.

h3921.definition: from {{h3920}}; something to capture with, i.e. a noose; being taken.

h3922.definition: from {{h3212}}; a journey; Lekah, a place in Palestine; Lecah.

h3923.definition: from an unused root of uncertain meaning; Lakish, a place in Palestine; Lachish.

h3924.definition: from the same as {{h3883}}; a loop; loop.

h3925.definition: a primitive root; properly, to goad, i.e. (by implication) to teach (the rod being an Oriental incentive); (un-) accustomed, × diligently, expert, instruct, learn, skilful, teach(-er, -ing).

h3926.definition: a prolonged and separable form of the prepositional prefix; to or for; at, for, to, upon.

h3927.definition: or לְמוֹאֵל; from {{h3926}} and {{h410}}; (belonging) to God; Lemuel or Lemoel, a symbolic name of Solomon; Lemuel.

h3928.definition: or לִמֻּד; from {{h3925}}; instructed; accustomed, disciple, learned, taught, used.

h3929.definition: from an unused root of uncertain meaning; Lemek, the name of two antediluvian patriarchs; Lamech.

h3931.definition: a primitive root; to deride; mock.

h3932.definition: a primitive root; to deride; by implication (as if imitating a foreigner) to speak unintelligibly; have in derision, laugh (to scorn), mock (on), stammering.

h3934.definition: from {{h3932}}; a buffoon; also a foreigner; mocker, stammering.

h3935.definition: from an unused root of uncertain meaning; Ladah, an Israelite; Laadah.

h3936.definition: from the same as {{h3935}}; Ladan, the name of two Israelites; Laadan.

h3937.definition: a primitive root; to speak in a foreign tongue; strange language.

h3938.definition: a primitive root; to swallow greedily; causatively, to feed; feed.

h3939.definition: from an unused root supposed to mean to curse; wormwood (regarded as poisonous, and therefore accursed); hemlock, wormwood.

h3940.definition: or לַפִּד; from an unused root probably meaning to shine; a flambeau, lamp or flame; (fire-) brand, (burning) lamp, lightning, torch.

h3941.definition: feminine plural of {{h3940}}; Lappidoth, the husband of Deborah; Lappidoth.

h3942.definition: from the prepositional prefix (to or for) and {{h6440}}; anterior; before.

h3943.definition: a primitive root; properly, to bend, i.e. (by implication) to clasp; also (reflexively) to turn around or aside; take hold, turn aside (self).

h3945.definition: a primitive root; to deride; scorn.

h3946.definition: from an unused root thought to mean to stop up by a barricade; perhaps fortification; Lakkum, a place in Palestine; Lakum.

h3947.definition: a primitive root; to take (in the widest variety of applications); accept, bring, buy, carry away, drawn, fetch, get, infold, × many, mingle, place, receive(-ing), reserve, seize, send for, take (away, -ing, up), use, win.

h3948.definition: from {{h3947}}; properly, something received, i.e. (mentally) instruction (whether on the part of the teacher or hearer); also (in an active and sinister sense) inveiglement; doctrine, learning, fair speech.

h3949.definition: from {{h3947}}; learned; Likchi, an Israelite; Likhi.

h3950.definition: a primitive root; properly, to pick up, i.e. (generally) to gather; specifically, to glean; gather (up), glean.

h3952.definition: a primitive root; to lick or lap; lap, lick.

h3953.definition: a primitive root; to gather the after crop; gather.

h3954.definition: from {{h3953}}; the after crop; latter growth.

h3955.definition: from an unused root of uncertain meaning; apparently juice, i.e.; (figuratively) vigor; also a sweet or fat cake; fresh, moisture.

h3956.definition: or לָשֹׁן; also (in plural) feminine לְשֹׁנָה; from {{h3960}}; the tongue (of man or animals), used literally (as the instrument of licking, eating, or speech), and figuratively (speech, an ingot, a fork of flame, a cove of water); babbler, bay,   evil speaker, language, talker, tongue, wedge.

h3957.definition: from an unused root of uncertain meaning; a room in a building (whether for storage, eating, or lodging); chamber, parlour. Compare {{h5393}}.

h3958.definition: from an unused root of uncertain meaning; a gem, perhaps the jacinth; ligure.

h3959.definition: the same as {{h3958}}; Leshem, a place in Palestine; Leshem.

h3960.definition: a primitive root; properly, to lick; but used only as a denominative from {{h3956}}; to wag the tongue, i.e. to calumniate; accuse, slander.

h3961.definition: (Aramaic) corresponding to {{h3956}}; speech, i.e. a nation; language.

h3962.definition: from an unused root thought to mean to break through; a boiling spring; Lesha, a place probably East of the Jordan; Lasha.

h3963.definition: from an unused root of uncertain meaning; a measure for things dry; half homer.

h3966.definition: from the same as {{h181}}; properly, vehemence, i.e. (with or without preposition) vehemently; by implication, wholly, speedily, etc. (often with other words as an intensive or superlative; especially when repeated); diligently, especially, exceeding(-ly), far, fast, good, great(-ly), × louder and louder, might(-ily, -y), (so) much, quickly, (so) sore, utterly, very (  much, sore), well.

h3967.definition: or מֵאיָה; properly, a primitive numeral; a hundred; also as a multiplicative and a fraction; hundred((-fold), -th),   sixscore.

h3968.definition: the same as {{h3967}}; Meah, a tower in Jerusalem; Meah.

h3969.definition: (Aramaic) corresponding to {{h3967}}; properly, a primitive numeral; a hundred; also as a multiplicative and a fraction}; hundred.

h3971.definition: usually מוּם; as if passive participle from an unused root probably meaning to stain; a blemish (physically or morally); blemish, blot, spot.

h3972.definition: apparently a form of {{h3971}}; properly, a speck or point, i.e. (by implication) something; with negative, nothing; fault,   no(-ught), ought, somewhat, any (no-)thing.

h3974.definition: or מָאֹר; also (in plural) feminine מְאוֹרָה; or מְאֹרָה; from {{h215}}; properly, a luminous body or luminary, i.e. (abstractly) light (as an element); figuratively, brightness, i.e.cheerfulness; specifically, a chandelier; bright, light.

h3975.definition: feminine passive participle of {{h215}}; something lighted, i.e. an aperture; by implication, a crevice or hole (of a serpent); den.

h3976.definition: from {{h239}}; (only in the dual) a pair of scales; balances.

h3978.definition: from {{h398}}; an eatable (includ. provender, flesh and fruit); food, fruit, (bake-)meat(-s), victual.

h3979.definition: from {{h398}}; something to eat with, i.e. a knife; knife.

h3980.definition: from {{h398}}; something eaten (by fire), i.e. fuel; fuel.

h3982.definition: from {{h559}}; something (authoritatively) said, i.e. an edict; commandment, decree.

h3984.definition: (Aramaic) probably from a root corresponding to {{h579}} in the sense of an inclosure by sides; a utensil; vessel.

h3985.definition: a primitive root; to refuse; refuse, × utterly.

h3988.definition: a primitive root; to spurn; also (intransitively) to disappear; abhor, cast away (off), contemn, despise, disdain, (become) loathe(some), melt away, refuse, reject, reprobate, × utterly, vile person.

h3989.definition: from {{h644}}; something baked, i.e. a batch; baken.

h3990.definition: from the same as {{h651}}; something opaque; darkness.

h3992.definition: a primitive root; to be bitter or (causatively) to embitter, i.e. be painful; fretting, picking.

h3993.definition: from {{h693}}; an ambuscade; lie in ambush, ambushment, lurking place, lying in wait.

h3995.definition: from {{h914}}; a separation, i.e. (concretely) a separate place; separate.

h3996.definition: from {{h935}}; (with or without {{h8121}}); an entrance (the place or the act); specifically sunset or the west; also (adverb with preposition) towards; by which came, as cometh, in coming, as men enter into, entering, entrance into, entry, where goeth, going down,   westward. Compare {{h4126}}.

h3999.definition: from {{h2986}} in the sense of flowing; a deluge; flood.
